item.description:
Dracula, bored and hungry, has thrown a masquerade ball, and invited all the townsfolk for dinner (and maybe a few for dessert). The problem: Some monsters in clever disguises have crashed the party. The bigger problem: Van Helsing is afoot, and everything is at stake.

It's murder on the dance floor, but which monster will divert attention to the others and have the feast to themselves?

Will the Werewolf sate its hunger? Will Dr. Jekyll unleash her wild side? Or will Van Helsing save the townspeople and ruin the party for everyone?

Dracula's Feast is social game of logical deduction for 4 to 8 players. It takes 5 minutes to learn, and less than 10 minutes to play.

Each turn, players guess, or dance with another player. Once they have enough information, they reveal their role and accuse the entire party - but certain characters have unique victory conditions, and so it's a race against the rest of the party to be the first to win.

item.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from VFG, a company in Germany.

name.value: Battle of the Bands: World Tour Edition

item.description:
The premier Rock and Roll Card Game is back...but now it's taking over the world! Battle of the Bands: World Tour Edition, the game where you are the star of your own music group.

This new edition represents the natural evolution of the original Battle of the Bands game and its expansions. The game mechanics have been streamlined, tightened, and improved over many years of play. New cards have been added that reflect the changes in music and the industry since the first Battle of the Bands incarnation. Famous cities and venues have been added to truly make this the "World Tour Editon"

With new cool and crazy band members and instruments, reputations that will elevate or cripple your band...you will be armed to the teeth when you hit the stage! Perform Hit Singles, work the Music Biz and ultimately blow your competition off the stage as you fight for Gigs all over the world!

Originally the basic game had a 13+ age level, now it's all ages friendly. BUT if you don't want to play Radio Disney you can add the Sex, Drugs and Rock and Roll expansion for the real band experience! With the Back Stage Pass and Front Row Center cards, you will expand your gaming experience to new heights and depths, just like the the music business. Pop, Rock, Metal, Punk, Funk, R&B, Country (and Western!), Thrash, Swedish Black Metal, Jazz... even the questionable sounds they call "music" today! It's all here for your gaming enjoyment.

A great gateway game for folks who love music but aren't into games...yet.

link.value: Battle of the Bands: Backstage Pass
Battle of the Bands: Encore Edition

item.description:
Sweet Sabotage is a board game about maids, butlers, desserts, and SABOTAGE! Build and serve your customers desserts to please your master, or destroy other player’s progress through sabotage! The cafe inheritance is on the line, make sure YOU win it!

Players start by choosing a maid/butler, and each of them have specific skills. Customers come in with their dessert card order, and the player has to collect ingredients to fill up the dessert card and serve the customer successfully. Be sure to act fast though! Some customers are impatient and will not tolerate slow service!

If you can't find the ingredient you urgently need, or you have to prevent someone from serving their final customer and winning the game, you can draw a Sabotage Card. These cards are powerful, and allows you to steal ingredients from other players, or even wreck their dessert forcing them to start over... but be careful! You can draw a CAUGHT card and you lose points!

The first player to reach a certain amount of favor points (gained from serving desserts to customers) wins the game, and the inheritance of the whole cafe!

Enter the world of the Mame-ista Championship! Who will be the best Hiyoko dripper? \"Hiyoko\" means chickpea, but these chickpeas are so cute they almost look like little chicks.

Players take turns in trying to tip out a combination of beans. But you need to be careful as sometimes 1 bean may tip out...or a LOT! Only the player who is able to get the right combination of beans over a certain amount of rounds (depending on the number of players) can be declared the Mame-ista winner!

On a turn you tip out some beans, if you get a blend/straight combination you can try one more time to get another combination. If you are unsuccessful, you remove 1 bean from the ones that fell out, and try one more time.

item.description:
Welcome to the world of Pro Wrestling! You must win at any cost or face the wrath of your sponsors. This year there are six new wrestlers debuting, so go out and win some matches!

Over the four seasons of maskmen, whoever has won the most points is the winner. In a round, players can play cards or pass on their turn. Players play 1-3 cards on their turn of the same type of wrestler (that hasn't already been played), to help resolve the strength of the wrestler. The faster you get rid of your cards, the better your chances of winning. As soon as you rid your cards you get to take the highest point token available, then the next player to go out gets the next token. Once there is only one player remaining, the round ends and that player gets the -1 token.

item.description:
Quaff is a collectible card game with fast-paced gameplay and a sense of humour.

The object of Quaff is to eliminate all other players whilst simultaneously attempting to remain in the game. Pick a deck - be that the horde of zombies, the superhero, the spaceship, or the fantasy army - and sparingly play cards to take down your opponents.

At the start of each round, players bid to determine the total cost of the cards they can play this round - however this is linked to the amount of drink consumed. Cards, ranging from permanents (which remain in play until removed by the effects of another card) to counters (which can be used on an opponent's turn to hinder their strategy), are utilised to decrease a player's life points. Once they reach 0, they are eliminated.

Contrées is a two player abstract game based on the mechanism of majority and surrounding.

Short resume of the rules:
The board is modular, it is made of specific hexagonal territories.
On that board each player plays his pawns on the corner of the hexagons and try to control as much territories as possible.
When a player have 4 pawn around a territory, he can place a possession mark on it and remove the enemy pawns from it. 
It is pretty simple but be careful, like in the game of GO, you can surround the opponent pawns and capture them.
When both player have played all their pawns, the one who control the most territories wins.

item.description:
Sticks, Stones and Dragonflame is a 2P micro-game in which each player attempts to destroy the castle of their sworn enemy. Castles are formed by 6 cards or locations, numbered 1 to 6.

Every turn, players secretly roll a die and assault the matching location of their opponent's castle. However, players are allowed (and encouraged) to lie about their die result. The consequences of getting caught are dire, but getting away with the lie will bring victory much more swiftly. In addition, players have the option to manipulate luck by employing the services of powerful reinforcements.

Whenever a location is destroyed, the card is flipped and can't be used or assaulted again. Once the Heart of the Castle is destroyed, the owner of the castle loses the game and their opponent is declared the winner!

In Grad Wars all players are students in different Universities. Their aim is to get their degree before everyone else does by passing 20 lessons first. They do this either by studying hard, or by visiting the other players in their classroom and harassing them.

Players can pass up to 5 lessons in every turn. They get their grade by rolling a 10-sided die for every lesson and then modifying the die with cards thrown by themselves or other players.

Cards can be adding or subtracting from a grade, and they can be special cards. But basically they describe student life as it is, or rather as we think it is. Players drink tons of coffee, they get shut in in bunkers to study focused, and they give exams using a Divine Pen. They also invade other players’ homes to sabotage their alarm clock, and they cause a Zombie Apocalypse inside other players’ classrooms. And they start crying in front of professors to get a passing grade, they cheat like there is no tomorrow, and they go to parties that cause year-long hangovers. Grad Wars is a game for the students who want to get their degree first no matter what the cost, or the means.

Στο παιχνÎ¯δι αυτÏŒ ο παÎ¯χτης εÎ¯ναι φοιτητÎ­ς σε διαφορετικÎ­ς σχολÎ­ς. ΣκοπÏŒς του παιχνιδιοÏ εÎ¯ναι να πÎ¬ρει πτυχÎ¯ο πριν απÏŒ τους υπÏŒλοιπους, συμπληρÏŽνοντας 20 περασμÎ­να μαθÎ®ματα. ΑυτÏŒ γÎ¯νεται εÎ¯τε με το να κÎ¬τσει να διαβÎ¬σει, Î® με το να πηγαÎ¯νει στη σχολÎ® του Î¬λλου και να τον παρενοχλεÎ¯. Σε κÎ¬θε γÏρο μπορεÎ¯ να δÏŽσει μÎ­χρι 5 μαθÎ®ματα, και οι γÏροι συνεχÎ¯ζονται μÎ­χρι να βγει κÎ¬ποιος νικητÎ®ς.

Οι κÎ¬ρτες περιγρÎ¬φουν τη φοιτητικÎ® ζωÎ® Î­τσι ÏŒπως εÎ¯ναι, Î® μÎ¬λλον Î­τσι ÏŒπως πιστεÏουμε ÏŒτι εÎ¯ναι. Ο παÎ¯χτης πÎ¯νει τÏŒνους καφÎ­, κλεÎ¯νεται σε πυρηνικÎ¬ καταφÏγια για να διαβÎ¬σει πιο συγκεντρωμÎ­νος, γρÎ¬φει εξετÎ¬σεις με το ΣτυλÏŒ των ΘεÏŽν. ΜπαÎ¯νει στο σπÎ¯τι του Î¬λλου και του σαμποτÎ¬ρει το ξυπνητÎ®ρι, κλεÎ¯νει γρÎ¯πη σε Î­να βαζÎ¬κι και το βÎ¬ζει κÎ¬τω απÏŒ μÏτες, στÎ­λνει ΖÏŒμπι ΣυμφοιτητÎ­ς στο αμφιθÎ­ατρο των συμπαικτÏŽν του. item.description: Each of the participants of the game becomes one of the heroes of the Erenthi world, wandering around the vast lands on their own or with their allies in search of magical stones. The task of the player involves getting the treasure or thwart the other participants' plans. An important element of the game is defining an ally and an enemy, owing to how easier it is to win and eliminate the competition. Each round ends by dealing the award cards and establishing the wounds incurred during the round. The player who has gained the most stones wins.

item.description:
From the publisher's website:

Welcome to Top Billing! In this game, you and your friends become competing movie producers working on a film. Your objective is to duke it out with the others to put your unique imprint on the final film by gathering Actors, Sets, and Props. By strategically putting them together to earn you the most points, you can earn the title of executive producer and Top Billing!

Welcome to DeckQuest, a light RPG-simulating card game!

This game has been designed to be a simple yet fulfilling light RPG adventure in card format. This game requires no dice, no character sheets, no miniatures, and no complicated math.

DeckQuest is easy to set up: simply select your character (one of four) and the relevant stat cards. Select your adventure--dungeon or outdoors--and create your adventure deck. The adventure deck consists of path cards, monsters, events, and locations. Your goal? Defeat the dragon for fame and glory!

DeckQuest has very little text and uses simple yet expandable rules, making it a great "gateway" game for kids or non-gamers, but enough depth to make it a great filler game for more advanced players. It requires no dice or any supplies--just the cards!

Game of observation and reaction for young children. One player throws a pair of six-sided dice to establish the target color combination. Players then search amongst a pile of butterfly figures for the butterfly with the matching color combination. The player who finds (i.e., "catches") the correct butterfly receives a scoring counter. The first player to get five counters wins the game.

item.description:
Augmented to be more than human, you have but one task: save the last of humanity!

You are a Psyborg. You have been augmented to be more than human with robotic limbs and powers of telekinesis. You have but one task: save the last of humanity! But it isn't going the way you expected... Other Psyborgs are out there, trying to kill you while they steal the glory of saving humanity!

Your Job:
• Kill other Psyborgs! 
• Find, steal and protect humans! 
• Make sure you are the last Psyborg standing with a human under your protection!

The Rules:

• Shuffle all the cards, minus the rules cards, together
• Deal everyone two cards
• Determine who goes first
• At the start of turn, draw a card
• After drawing a card players can choose to play a card from their hand or pass.
• If there are no more cards to draw, shuffle the discard pile into the draw pile.
• The winner is the last player left alive with a human in their hand.

Each card has different effects - Shields block all cards used against you, Humans are to be protected and discarding one means you are out of the game, EMP Pulses forces a player to discard a card of their choice, Scans reveal Humans, etc...

If you don't have a Human card in hand, you want to find and take one from another player. If you do have a Human, you want to protect it from other players. Attack other players, but make sure you have a Human by the end of the game, or everyone loses.

Location for high-quality PnP files is located here.
The Game Crafter page of the game is located here.

This game won first place for the 24 hour contest - May 2014.

~ Introduction ~
Ever wondered if you could survive the Apocalypse? Test out your survival strategies in the most realistic Post-Apocalyptic card game ever created, Survivalistic! Set in a modern day Post-Apocalyptic era, Survivalistic lets a player embark on an epic journey with fellow survivors. While on this journey, survivors will unite with one another to form clans. A player's clan must outlast and outwit all opposing clan members in order to win. Survivalistic is sure to thrill any gamer on any level. Please feel free to check out the brand new card game Survivalistic!

~ Family Friendly ~
Don't be mistaken by the theme, this game makes for a great family game! No violence, no explicit images, and no brutality. This game focuses on survival strategy by using moral methods instead. These methods include: farming, cultivating, pillaging, adapting to new environments, purifying water, communication skills, gathering resources, resource management, hunting, and scavenging. The youngsters will find the game very easy to learn and enjoy playing time and time again!

~ Player Interaction ~
The player interaction in Survivalistic makes it a great social game. Just the fact that you have so many opportunities to get back at your opponent makes it incredibly fun. Players may find themselves losing at one point and then winning the next! Because you are often stealing and battling other players for resources there is hardly a dull moment.

~ Game Play ~
The deck symbolizes the various paths in which one can take through the apocalyptic world. While on this path your prime objective will be to build a team of survivors. This team of survivors will be called your clan. You can find water, food, equipment, and fellow survivors along the way to enhance your clan. Your clan members will display many skills while on your journey and these events are represented through clan member abilities. There are many strategies to this game through all the different types of cards and there are countless number of ways you can arrange your clan. In order for your clan to reign supreme they must be nourished with food and water. Nourished clan members may battle opposing clans for valuable resources. In the end, the first clan to have three clan members fully nourished at the same time wins the game. These elements make up the basis of the game. You can use any combination of cards but one thing must happen, you must survive!

Word Throwing Game is a word dice game where players take turns and roll the dice once. They form words of four or more letters. Blank sides are wild.

Scoring:

Each letter used scores 5 points. 
Players score a bonus of 25 points for spelling their first name.
Players score a bonus of 50 points for using all 12 dice.

The first player to reach 500 points is the winner.

A word dice game with 12 letter dice.

Players roll the dice and make words of three or more letters. Blank sides are wild.

Scoring:


 1 point for each letter used
 35 bonus points for spelling Throw or Word


If a player uses all 12 dice, he gets a free roll.

The winner is the first person to reach 200 points.

Challenge is a word dice game similar to Poker Challenge. Players roll the letter dice and try to form words to score points. However, it is different because of its board with red and blue boxes which can double or triple letters and words.

It is for two to ten players. Everyone plays in turn for two minutes.

A word dice game for 2 to 4 players. Players take turns to roll the dice and race against an hourglass to spell words for points. Similar to Challenge, it is also played on a board with double and triple spaces. Unlike Challenge, it is limited to four players.

A word dice game where players roll the dice and make words to score points. The player with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.

This 2003 edition by Endless Games includes 22 (14mm, white) letter cubes, rather than the 15 in the original version. The scoring in this edition is also different. Rather than squaring the letter count for each word, a point value is assigned to each letter based upon the length of the word it is part of, with letters used in longer words worth more. Crossed words score the shared letter twice, possibly with two different values.

Scoring:


 3 letter words – 1 point per letter
 4 letter words – 2 points per letter 
 5 letter words and up – 3 points per letter 
 5 point bonus for using all 22 dice
 Subtract a point for each unused die

Flynn, the pirate owl is a real mischief-maker. Very secretly he has pinched anything and everything that he could fi nd on deck and has stashed it away in the look-out – the crow‘s nest: the gold drinking cups of the crew, the captain‘s sword, the treasure chest, the jewellery for the lady pirates and a few mice – just in case. You can never know how long you‘re going to be left sitting high and dry. Cheekily, he‘s throned high up in the crow‘s nest and is smirking joyfully over so many riches. It‘s no surprise that the ship‘s crew is fuming and want their belongings back!

Find the objects that Flynn has stashed away in the crow‘s nest. A die shows you what you have to look for. Like in the trick with the table cloth you have to pull a cord stick to a card and hope that the Flynn stays in his nest and that the nest is not toppling over.

Have I dressed up as wolf or fox, or as stork or crow? Sixteen cards are on the table, showing children dressed up in animal constumes. In addition, there are sixteen cards showing the corresponding animals. They are in a face-down pile.

In variant for young children, each child draws a card. The first player to find the correct costume, gains the card.

Older children play a question/answer game. By asking questions like "Can you fly?" or "Are you a pet?," they attempt to guess what card the other player is holding.

Battle of Byeokjegwan is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #1.

The Battle of Byeokjegwan is a battle between Japan and China, fought in Korean peninsula on 27 January 1593.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Byeokjegwan

Including one mapsheet, six Chinese units, nine Japanese units, two markers and two dice. Each unit represents one commander and his troop. Rules, tutorial and historical notes are included in "Battle on the Table".

Chinese victory condition is decline of Japanese morale or killing Kobayakawa Takakage or Ukita Hideie. Japanese victory condition is rise of Japanese morale or killing Li Rusong.

item.description:
Singapore will be the first game of The Second World War Series (TSWW) from Diffraction Entertainment for the Pacific Theater of War.

It will cover the campaigns in Malaya, Singapore, Burma and areas of the Dutch East Indies for the entire Second World War.

The game is projected to include not less than 18 Map segments, 8-10 countersheets plus the usual Rules, Charts, Orders of Battle and high quality pair of D10 Dice.

Once more, conflict rages across the world of Aerim. You are one of the Eternals, a group of immortals forever waging war from the shadows. Call forth your champions to battle against those of your timeless foes. Harness the legacy of each champion's deeds as they echo across time to empower the next. For the Champions of Aerim, this cycle continues, as it always has and always will. For the Eternals, there is only...strife.

Strife, a two-player strategy card game that plays in around an hour, is a game where you always know your opponent's options. Aside from mastering the unique combo-creating gameplay of your champions, figuring out how to outmaneuver your opponent is where the true challenge lies.

Each player has the same hand of ten champions and will simultaneously play them as they fight over key locations throughout Aerim worth varying victory points. Each champion has a battle ability that's triggered during battles and a legacy ability that can be used only while on top of the legacy pile. This creates an intricate latticework of strategy for the players as each champion must be considered for not only what he can do in the current battle, but for which ability he will add to the next.

Further impacting the critical decisions within the game is the Fatestone tie-breaking system. The Fatestone starts at a value of one, and whoever holds the Fatestone die loses all ties; that player may instead pass the stone to his opponent to claim a victory in that tie, but doing so raises the value of the Fatestone by one each time it is passed. At the end of the game, the player holding the Fatestone adds its final value to his victory point tally. Whichever player has the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

We've done the research, and we've determined that more than 36 million additional games could be played each year if it took less time to choose a start player. That's almost 2.5 million extra games every day.

Back in 2006, Ted Alspach provided a solution to this problem with a simple card game called Start Player. Just turn over a card, and you'll know who the start player is.

That was a wonderful solution...for 2006. But we're clearly living in the future now, and there's no time for getting out the box, shuffling cards, and finally turning a card over. It's time for something better, faster, and a whole lot more technologically advanced. It's time for Start Player Express.

Start Player Express consists of four custom dice. There's no shuffling, there's a whole lot less reading, and there's no messing with a box. (You're not a Neanderthal, are you?) Just roll the dice and BOOM! You know who goes first.

You're a mad scientist with the goal of evolving cute animals into minions in order to destroy the enemy's animals. Each creature can evolve into three different evolution trees, each with their own unique skills.

Evilution is a stand-alone card game. Each player chooses four animals to start the game with and performs actions each turn to further their position. Once you kill all the opposing creatures, you win the game.

In order to evolve your animals, you'll need to purchase evolution trees. You can earn money through sponsorships as well as completing objectives. You can also use the money to hire lab assistants and purchase equipment.

Also, every turn you'll either navigate random events or discover potions with good and bad effects. Some of your creatures may die, but that's a sacrifice you must be willing to make.

Do you have what it takes to be the best Mad Scientist? Only time will tell.

Script-o-Gram is a word dice game with 13 cubes where players make words to score points.

It is similar to Spill and Spell and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, but has several differences:

Crossword play is forbidden, dice are not touched once cast, play is reminiscent of Boggle.

Scoring: per letter value, variations include one word scored or multiple words scored.

item.description:
Letter Dice is a word dice game similar to Spill and Spell and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, where players make words to score points.

It scores differently than those games, with objectives like longest word and most words:

Throw the dice and race against your opponents (and the clock) to turn the jumbled-up letters into words. Can you make the longest word? Can you make the greatest number of words? Can you score the most points? Lots of different rapid-fire challenges for word game fans of all ages.

It is for 2 or more players.

Letter Dice by HABA is a word dice game similar to Letter Dice by Fun and Games and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, where players make words to score points.

HABA's version is for 1-6 players. It has several play modes:

1. Crosswords: One player rolls all 13 dice and forms words in a crossword puzzle shape. Players agree on the length of the round (between 2-5 minutes) and the number of rounds before the start of the game. Letters used score their point value. Letters used in two words score for both words. Letters not used are subtracted from the score.

When a player finishes making words, players can try to make a funny sentence with the words.

2. Letter Yatzi: The first player rolls all 13 dice and tries to form the longest word. Letters which don't fit are rolled again. At least one letter must be put aside each time. Play continues until all letters are used or set aside. Points are scored for the letters used. Unused letters are not counted.

If a player uses all 13 letters, the score for the word is doubled.

3. Vocabulary: All players together make one word, with all 13 dice if possible. One player is chosen as the secretary. Players try to make words with the letters of the first word, and the secretary keeps track of them. The winner is the player who can find the last intelligible word.

Texarkana Trivia is a knock-off of Trivial Pursuit, focused on local trivia about the Texas-Arkansas-Louisiana (Tex-Ark-Ana) tri-state area. Two to four players roll-and-move around a board decorated with local businesses, answer questions about local history and miscellanea, and collect four colored pegs for their pawn. The first player to bring a pawn with all four pegs to the center wins!

The Outlaws is a euro-style card game where you get to lead a posse of bandits in the American Wild West. The meanest cowboys and most daring heists are all up for grabs in this fight to be the baddest outlaw in town.

You start by hiring characters to build your posse. Send your gang on jobs by matching their stats to what the job requires and roll some dice to find out if they brought back some loot, earned you some reputation, or got shot in the process. The characters and jobs all come from a communal field, so you'll have to plan ahead and act quickly to get the good stuff. 
 The player with the most reputation will win the game, and rep only comes from doing jobs, so you won't get ahead by playing it safe. You'll have to take chances, and your posse will probably die, but that's just the nature of the game for The Outlaws.

item.description:
Mariáš (the final sound is pronounced as "sh") is the most popular card game in the Czech Republic and Slovakia, often seen being played in pubs. This trick-taking game is the basis for Ulti, the national card game of Hungary.

It is played with a 32-card deck, similar to the William Tell deck but with specific Bohemian art. There are four suits: hearts, bells, acorns, and leaves, each with eight cards: ace, king, over-knave, under-knave, 10, 9, 8, and 7.

The most common setup is with three players, with one player playing alone against a partnership of the other two for each hand. The lone player seeks to win more card points than the other two players together. Points are received for winning aces and tens in tricks, winning the last trick, and for the combination of king and over-knave of a suit. There are also several bonuses and penalties that affect the final score.

(Description borrowed from Mariáš page on pagat.com)

item.description:
Learn key facts about the 50 states in the United States of America playing this fun, easy-to-learn card game!

State Master is simple to learn, easy to set up, requires little space, can be played in as little as 10 minutes, and keeps all players engaged throughout as everyone plays in every round (i.e., no waiting your turn!).

You and your kids will learn each state's:


 Abbreviation
 Capital
 Largest City
 Year of Statehood
 Nickname
 Population Rank
 Location on the Map


A BETTER WAY OF LEARNING FACTS
While flash cards are great for committing facts to short-term memory, they don't engage kids for long. Games provide a good alternative, but in most "educational" games, the learning comes slowly as players must wait their turn to get a question and rarely get the same question twice in the same game.

In State Master, all players participate in every turn, so everyone is learning and testing their knowledge constantly. Player who get the wrong answer take a quick moment to study all six facts on the state card and then try to get the same card the next turn, immediately putting their new knowledge to use.

State Master is fun for all ages and its a game in which younger players can often beat older players as they tend to be better at retaining facts.

				
					================

HOW TO PLAY
				
					================

NUMBER OF PLAYERS
2 to 6

OBJECTIVE
Finish the game with the most cards.

COMPONENTS
50 State Cards
6 Colored Dice
1 Category Die
1 Map Card

SETUP
Shuffle State Cards.
Place 5 State Cards on the table with the flag side up for each player in the game: 10 cards if there are 2 players, 15 cards if there are 3 players, etc.
Place the Blank Map face up on the table.
Place the Filled Map face down on the table.
Each player chooses a colored die.

ROUND PLAY
Each player rolls his/her die to decide who will be Player 1 for Round 1.
Player 1 puts his/her die on top of one of the State Cards.
Moving clockwise, each player puts his/her die on of a different State Card.
Player 1 then rolls the Category Die.
Each player, starting with Player 1 and moving clockwise, must then say the correct answer for his/her chosen state for the category shown. For example, if the die says "CAPITAL," a player with his/her die on New York would say "Albany."
If a player correctly answers the category question, that player tries to locate his/her state on the Blank Map.

ENDING A ROUND
Players who answer correctly and are able to locate their states win their cards. All others replace them face down on the table (but not before studying the card a little so they can get the right answer the next round).

WINNING THE GAME
Rounds continue until fewer State Cards remain face down than there are players in the game. The player with the most State Cards at end of the game is the winner.

Two players confront one another to construct the least high tower with 3D polyominoes.

Both players have a gameboard 3x3. In the center of the table, there are 29 3D polyominoes. Initially, each player chooses a polyomino. When both players have chosen a polyomino, they exchange. Everyone must now place the piece on his board. A polyomino must not exceed the gameboard. Then everyone chooses a new polyomino.

When each player has placed 14 polyominoes, the game is over. The player whose tower is less high wins.

Die verrückte Reise durch Rheinland-Pfalz has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Rheinland-Pfalz, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

A high speed death race against the clock. Drivers have a limited time to out wit, out manoeuvre and out pace the competition. Their fission powered Skimmers speed along future highways ramming each other and firing dangerous energy weapons to try and secure a win in the controversial Light-Speed Cup. When the race starts the clock starts and players have until the time runs out to wipe their opponents off of the track. They can aggressively pursue the other racers and try to destroy them, they can speed ahead and try to force the other vehicle off of the end of track or they can duck and dodge allowing the other Skimmers to tear each other apart before speeding home to victory. Which ever player’s Skimmer is in the best condition when the clock reaches zero wins the Cup. This game is a thrill packed adrenaline ride where mayhem reigns and there is never a dull moment!The LSC moto is Action Not Protraction!

This games puts 2-6 players in control of one Skimmer (futuristic race car) each. They race each other along an never ending treadmil like race track that is made out of 4 rolling tiles. When the race starts an electronic timer is started, it has between 10 and 15 minutes on it per player, and when the timer runs out and the buzzer souds the game is over. Durring the game players have to ram and shoot at each other to try and destroy the enemy skimmers before the timer runs out. Each skimmer has different strengths and weaknesses and players get to choose their own drivers which also have unique talents. There is another way of destroy other skimmers and that is to get so far ahead of them that when the track is rolled they fall off of the back of it. In this way the lightly amoiured fast skimmers can win the game aswell.

In the worker placement game Fields of Arle, set in the German region of East Frisia, players develop an estate and expand their territory by cutting peat and building dikes.

The game covers nine half-years with alternating summer and winter seasons, and each season allows or denies specific player actions. Different and detailed manufacturing processes allow a player to create goods needed to expand her estate. In addition, trades with adjoining municipalities can help a player gain the needed resources or goods for building and expanding.

テンデイズゲームズ (Ten Days Games)

item.description:
A player press the locomotive's chimney, and the train rolls along the track. When the train comes to the the first station, the player pushes the chimney and thus stops the train.

The player takes any passenger from the station who he thinks has the same color as his station. He shows the other players what color the passenger has under their "feet".

If the color matches the station, the player places the passenger at his station and then starts the train by pressing the chimney.

If the color does not match, the player puts the passenger back on the train, after showing the other players what color it is, and starts the train.

The train moves to the next station and the next player will have a turn.

The winner is the player who has collected the three passengers in the same color as his station.

A microgame of tricks and treasure.

The goal is to find the map leading to buried treasure. And someone on this pirate ship has the map! To win, find that map and hold on to it, surviving the round - or be the last pirate alive with the lowest ranking card.

Rules:

• Each player is dealt two cards.

• Players can choose to use one or two cards against their opponents, discard and draw a new card, or bluff.

• A player can bluff as long as they have at least one card of the card type needed to perform an action in their 
hand.

Example: Danielle has one “Barrel o’ Grog” card and one “Cannon” card in her hand. She decides that she wants to use the 
special ability that requires two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. This special requires that every player with a “Barrel o’ Grog” 
card must place the grog card face up in front of them. That card is out of play for the rest of the game. Those players now may only have one card in their hand.

• If a player does not believe that another player has the cards to do the action they just performed, they may call 
the player’s bluff. If the first player was lying, they have to reveal the card that was the lie, and they discard their remaining card and draw a new one.

Example: John doesn’t believe Danielle has two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards. He calls her bluff. As Danielle did not have 
two “Barrel o’ Grog” cards, she places the “Cannon” card in front of her, as it was the lie - and that card is now 
out of play. She then discards her “Barrel o’ Grog” and draws a new card. She is now down to having only one card in her hand.

• When the deck runs out of cards, the discard pile may be shuffled back in to form the draw pile.

• When there are no more cards to be drawn and no discard pile, the players that are still alive reveal their hands and what is stored in their “Smuggler's Chambers”. The player with the lowest numbered card wins.

Drop Box location for PnP rules are located here.
Drop Box location for high-quality PnP card art is located here.

This game won first place for the 24 hour contest - March 2014.

Challenge and Persuade is a game of argument!

In this game, players develop arguments and challenge each others’ ideas. The game cards provide easy-to-read facts for any level player to construct an argument around topics at the nexus of energy, water, and climate. An adjective card (e.g. Lasting, Sustainable, Lucrative) is drawn each round that the players must use in conjunction with their fact cards to construct an argument. A Judge decides the winning argument using his own criteria. The player with the winning argument wins the round, and the first player to win three rounds wins the game!

Challenge and Persuade is a fun and social card game that challenges players to think about the choices we have in balancing our need for water and energy with the challenge of minimizing climate change.

Smart!
Through play, this game teaches fundamental knowledge about our environment, challenges players’ understanding of facts, and guides players to construct solid and convincing arguments. Challenge and Persuade teaches concepts and strengthens communication strategies required to engage in scientific discussions concerning our world today. Developed with a team of experienced scientists, gamers, and educators, Challenge and Persuade is aligned to national science standards and may be used in a variety of science, government and policy courses.

Fun!
This game, developed with teenagers and adults in mind, is engaging and stimulating for a wide range of ages. The game can quickly turn into a lively discussion involving current topics on water, energy, and climate.

Social!
Challenge and Persuade is an intensely interactive game in which players either act as Presenter or Judge. The presenters draw fact cards and construct convincing arguments to present to the judge. While the judge decides which argument is strongest, any player may challenge an argument!

Deal: American Dream is a board game for 3 to 6 players. Each player masters a clan and competes for the dominion of drug trafficking in the Americas.

Deal: American Dream is a strategic game where players recruit troops and clash over territories. Additionally, it incorporates an economic dimension; you can produce or buy dope, and sell it by striking deals with other players rather than confronting them. As every narco knows, spilling blood ain’t always good for business.

Finally, Deal: American Dream also has a roleplaying aspect to it; each player has secret objectives that require the use of deception and bluff. Regardless of which avenue to power you take, in the end, there can only be one winner: the first one to earn 10 respect points takes the cake. Every game of Deal: American Dream is unique and brings its share of negotiation, alliance and, of course, backstabbing!

All the components needed for a game of Deal Corner can be found in the Deal: American Dream's box. It was available separately in the Kickstarter.

name.value: Commander Mark's Fantastic Galactic Imagination Explorer

item.description:
"Welcome to my new Fantastic Galactic Imagination Explorer 3-D drawing game! Look at the dynamic NEW SECRET CITY ADVENTURES mural on your game board to become familiar with this imaginary universe. All game players are TRAVELERS and all game pieces are your PASSPORTS to these exciting places!

As you travel through the game, you'll learn about THE NEW SECRET CITY. The object of the game is to keep on playing until you can draw your very own completed version of THE NEW SECRET CITY ADVENTURES mural! Are you ready! Here we go!"
-from a flyer in the game box

Described as "The Ultimate 3-D Drawing Game", this is definitely a game for hyperactive youngsters. Players travel around the board collecting points and trying to learn the "12 Magic Words of Drawing".

Various activities on the game board ask the player to draw pictures, complete short stories, and find creative explanations for objects on the board's artwork.

name.value: Comanchería: The Rise and Fall of the Comanche Empire
Comanchería: The Rise and Fall of the Comanche Empire

item.description:
Comanchería is the second game in Joel Toppen's "First Nations" series. Like its predecessor, Navajo Wars, Comanchería is a solitaire game in which the player plays from the Native American tribe's point of view.

In Comanchería, the player takes command of the Comanche nation. The player must drive hostile tribes from the southern plains, establish dominance over the region, set up trade networks with both friendly tribes and colonial powers, and finally defend all of this against relentless military and cultural attack.

While many mechanics will feel similar to Navajo Wars, Comanchería is a very different game. Comanchería promises to deliver all the tough decisions and drama that Navajo Wars players have come to expect, but with a faster playing time and more streamlined victory objectives.

Players compete against each other in several rounds to gather different colors of keys.

After six rounds all players go to the vault, the gamemaster throws a colored die into the vault and then after lifting it, the player who has the key that matches the die face it has landed on, wins the game.

Two most important battles of the Thaddeus KoÅ›ciuszko Insurection. RacÅ‚awice, although they were just tactical victory, become symbol of brave and solidarity between social classes, because of the decisive role of scythes using militia knowns as "Kosynierzy" (Scythe-armed). Battle of Maciejowice was the last battle of Thaddeus KoÅ›ciuszko Insurection. Polish forces, outnumbered by Russians, lost the battle.

Space Frontier is a game of space exploration for 2-4 players. Players compete to spread their influence across a region of uncharted space. The game takes roughly an hour to an hour and a half to play with 2 players with each additional player adding about a half hour.

Each player controls a command ship and its supporting fleets. The command ship is a mobile factory, research lab, and ship carrier. Players will use it to construct the fleets that help spread their influence far and wide.

The modular space map is built from randomized tiles each game as players explore. The random map generation ensures no two games of Space Frontier are exactly the same.

Players gain influence through missions, research, trade, or conquest. Players can be as cooperative or antagonistic with each other as they wish. Thus, games can be played and won where military might reigns supreme, or without a shot being fired.

The game has 2 decks of cards: Fast Buck Cards (FB) and Market Value Cards (MV). Each player is dealt 7 FB cards, and a FB card is dealt face down in the middle of the table. This is the bonus card.

Players may draw 1 FB card per turn from the deck or the discard pile. They then check their FB cards for 3 of a kind and place them face down on the table. The player then draws a MV card, and follows what it says. It can either affect your hand's value or have you draw another FB or MV card.

When a player has no more FB cards in hand, that player gets a $150,000 bonus and the bonus card is revealed. If a player has a card that matches the bonus in hand, that player receives a $250,000 bonus. The other cards on the table are then scored. Play continues until someone reaches $1,000,000.

Objective: ballance your income/your expenses; learn mechanism of insolvency
 - acting by turns -
roll the die: each player moves forward according number on a circle; ending on a marked space draw appropiate card and follow instructions. Players are at the mercy of luck - but can protect themselves by spending their money carefully, underwriting riscs, ... Game ends after agreed time or completed circles.

note:
produced by F.X. Schmid; playing time strongly dependend on no. of participants; suitable for school classes.

name.value: Historia Eine historische Rätselrallye durch die Stadt Gmünd und das Lieser- und Maltatal

item.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 120; learn more about historical facts of the local region.
 - acting by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; draw appropiate (coloured) card and give correct answer; successful? Roll/move again (max 4 times). Ending on a red space (event card) follow instructions.

Objective: give most correct answers within a given time; learn more about the (greater) Braunschweig region
 - acting by turns -

Choose a starting place; move on a grid according die roll; draw appropriate card - city or 'Hoppla' - and give correct answer/follow instructions.

name.value: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis

item.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis, is graphically based on the late 80's cartoon that originated from the comic book by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

2 to 4 players play as one of the four Turtles competing around the board while trying to avoid traps and bad luck spaces. The object of the game is to reach the end of each game board, which supposedly represent a different mission:

Game 1: Rescue April
Game 2: Take Over The Technodrome
Game 3: Battle to Stop the Ooze
Game 4: Race for the Pizza Parlor

These four boards came on the back of the Ralston Cereal Boxes and as such are in conjunction a very simplistic version of similar games like "Snakes and Ladders". Just throw the dice and let luck decide in which space you´ll end up. Some spaces have rewards while others punishments. In reality is what you can expect from a board game that came on a cereal box, but it has a lot of charm and richness of details in the drawings and graphic design.

There was another Ralston´s TMNT cereal box board game called "Adventures In Turtleopolis" that came out during the same time, but it didn´t have art as nice as this nor as much TMNT thematic enemies and elements such as the Technodrome or the sewers.

item.description:
Objective: collect as many animals cards (pairs) as possible, bringing them back home & gaining bonus chips.
 - acting by turns -

Roll the die and move forward on a circle; flip appropiate animal card; finding a matching pair you may bring them gome gaining a bonus chip; a dragon will let you fly, a rat will turn over all already flipped cards.

Game ends after all animals are brought home.

In Penguin Smash, players are a group of penguins that can not take the cold. To stay warm in the south pole, they figure out that they can just smash each other to keep body temperature high! (What a genius penguin!)

Penguin Smash is a dexterity game in which players will put one hand on the table and take turns flipping one card from his/her own deck of penguin cards by the other hand. If the total number of the revealed penguin cards matches the corresponding penguin player's status card, everyone must race to SMASH that player's hand on the table. The first player to smash the penguin player's hand scores all the corresponding penguin cards. The player who manages to SMASH the most penguin will be the master of penguin smash and win the game.

Be alert! Some special cards will put your penguin into sleep or sent it to dinner, and therefore making the SMASH not easy as you may imagine.

Rycerze i Zamki (which means "Castles and Knights") is a part of Egmont Polska game series: "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie".

In the game the players fight to conquer castles using their knights. Each player is given the same set of knight cards. Each knight has three powers. The powers to conquer stone, brick and wooden castles.

On each turn one castle from the castle pile is revealed and then each player selects two cards from their hands and reveal them simultaneously. The player who's combined power of particular value (depending on the castle type) of their knights is the highest takes the castle and the next turn proceeds. The player who grabs the castles with the most points on them is the winner.

item.description:
A game for 2-players.

Materials

4 pawns, 2 black and 2 white.

49 Othello like tiles, black on one side and white on the other.

Definitions

Claim - An orthogonally adjacent group of friendly tiles.
Adjacent – adjacent from this point on will be considered orthogonally adjacent.

Goal

Win by capturing all of your opponent’s pawns or by having the largest claim.

Setup

Lay out the 49 tiles into an 7x7 black and white checkerboard pattern.

Then alternately starting with black, place a pawns onto an empty friendly color tile.

Rules

On a turn you must take one of the following actions.

1) Select an empty enemy colored tile that is in a straight line (horizontally or diagonally) with one of your friendly pawns, then flip this tile over and move the friendly pawn placing it on top of the tile just flipped or

2) Capture an enemy pawn by approach, this is done by moving a friendly pawn to an empty enemy tile (this tile must also be flipped over before completing the capture) that is adjacent to an enemy pawn, provided that the enemy pawn is on the continuation of the capturing pawns's movement line (which could be horizontally or diagonally) or

3) Move a friendly pawn freely within a claim that is occupied by that pawn.

The game ends when one of the following occurs.

1. When all enemy pawns are captured or

2. When players are unable of following either rules #1 or #2 after 2 consecutive turns.

Finally add up the tiles in your claims, the player with the largest claim or the player that managed to capture all the enemy pawns is the winner. If by chance there is a tie, look at each player’s second largest claim and so forth.

Restrictions

Unless performing a capture, you can't flip a tile of an opponent's claim if that claim is occupied by an opponent's piece.

O que seria da vida sem alguém ao nosso lado? Amizades que podem virar paixão e por que não amor?
 Em marry me?! Os jogadores são pessoas em busca de sua cara metade, com gostos variados, que ao longo dos anos passaram por vários relacionamentos, terão recaídas com os “ex”, para que no final possam dizer em alto e bom som “–Marry me?” (-casa comigo?) ou não 
(a vida não é perfeita).
Do que você gosta? 
 Pessoas mais velhas? Pessoas jovens? Loiras(o)? Morenas(o)? , independente do seu gosto pessoal, no fim o que vai realmente importar é ser feliz.

English translation:
What would life be without someone on our side? Friendships that can turn to passion and, why not, love?

In marry me?! Players are people searching for their soul mate, with varying tastes. Over the years, they may have gone through several relationships, and may relapse with an "ex", so in the end they can say loud and clear "Marry me?" (House me?) or not 
(Life is not perfect).

What do you like?

Regardless of your personal taste in the end what will really matter in this game is to be happy.

name.value: Der Tiger und der Bär spielen Schnipp-Schnapp

item.description:
54 cards (27 x 2) are mixed and equally handed out. Every player searches his card deck and sorts out every pair (two cards with identical small pictures in the upper quarter of the card). After that the deck is placed upside down in front of him. The starting player shouts "Schnipp" and all players begin to reveal their cards, placing them in front of their decks. The first player who notices that a pair is revealed shouts "Schnapp" and wins both piles of the regarding players’ decks. Then the "Schnapper" sorts out the included pair(s). If the shout howevers was incorrect, the regarding player loses all his revealed cards which are then placed in the middle of the table. These cards are now handled like cards from other players in front of their decks. The player with the most pair wins.

This edition contains illustrations by Janosch - famous german illustrator, author of children's books and novelist.

The music edition of Konito?. Complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card.

The object is to be the first to complete famous song titles and lyrics, or try to make your teammates find the right answer by any possible means.

KÅ‚uszyn 1610 covers the battle between Polish and Russo-Swedish forces during the Polish-Russian war 1609-1618. It was one of the most glorious victories of polish heavy cavalry Husaria, where 5600 polish Husars defeated 30 000 soldiers of Sweden and Russia.

This is a typical hex and counter wargame and first of the planned series of wargames taking place in XVI-XVII century.

Bitwy XXI Wieku (Battles of XXIth Century) is a wargame system taking place in the first decades of XXIth century. The game contains maps for central Europe, Ukraine and Iraq. The units belong to the Polish, Russian, American, Iraqi, German, Ukrainian and British armies.

The counters use NATO symbols, while each units has points table for different equipment for different conflicts - for example, the three tables for polish armored units are for T-72, PT-91 and Leopard tanks.

Each hex represents one kilometer and each counter a company. The game will be also available with wooden tiles instead of counters. There are three scenarios:
- Russian attack in Bartoszyce area, Poland, in 2014
- Ukrainian-Russian fights in Crimea in 2014
- British attack on Basra during second Iraq war in 2003

Following scenarios were published in the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine:
- BiaÅ‚y Konwój (2/2014)
- "Japkowa" Wojna (2/2014)
- Operacja "StraÅ¼ na Eufracie" (2/2014)
- Krymskie dzieci (1/2015)

A science fiction game published in White Dwarf (Issue 21 - Oct 1980), and was later released together with The Barbarian (a game published in a previous issue a year earlier) as one of their pocket games in Survival / The Barbarian.

Survival is a science fiction game depicting the struggle of Jardine, a crashed Scout, to reach safety. Along the trek he will meet and fight various vicious animals. While Survival is an excellent solitaire game, there are scenarios for up to six players.

Truth is a strategic Pattern making game of Divine proportions; featuring 270 graphic Scripture cards, with a Bible verse on each card!

Become Champion of Truth by receiving Blessings, Rewards, and Victory Points, from creating various types of Patterns.

Draw and Play cards each turn. Thwart your peers from making patterns, while building your own. Making certain patterns give various special bonuses to your efforts.

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. Collect 10 Victory Points
2. Achieve the Creation Pattern (6 Scriptures)
3. Achieve the Atonement Pattern (10 Spirits)

The first to meet one of the above Victory Conditions is proclaimed Champion of Truth!

Le Truc le + ("What's the most?") is "the most" fast and fun party game.

Each round, players draw a "most" card to determine what they will be voting for: "The most hilarious", "The most free", "The most incredible", "The most sexy", etc. Simultaneously, they then use their Vote cards to vote for which of the five Thing cards they believe is "the most" for that category. Each player who voted with the majority of players discards a "solo" point. The winning Thing card (or cards) is discarded and replaced by a new one, then a new round begins.

The first player to get rid of all ten of her solo points wins!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Immunity is a board game in which your immune system will fight against the pathogens agents that attempt to infect your body. Become the healthiest player of the table, and live all your life free of harmful diseases! Take the control of virus, bacteria and parasites, and strike the vital organs of your rivals!

In this card game, each player receives an organism board which shows the health of your five vital systems (nervous, cardiorespiratory, digestive, hepatic, and renal), as well as your age throughout the life. There are also two environment squares that will be occupied with the pathogens before they invade your organism. In addition, the board shows different human cells (red blood cells, immune cells, platelet, etc) that can be bought with oxygen. These cells are responsible for eliminating pathogens.

There are 3 types of deck cards in the game. Pathogen cards can be placed on the environment squares of the rivals, in order to infect and harm their organs. Medic cards can be used to prevent damage, transplant organs, eradicate microorganisms, etc. There is a common deck for all the players, the environmental deck, which represents hazardous effects that can affect the health of a person, like occupational accidents, blood donation and school fights.

The game emulates in a proper way some aspects of the immunity, like the inflammation, adverse effects of medicaments, the disease transmission, the spread of tumors, and many others.

Here comes the CAT FASHION SHOW! Dress your cats up and have them show off your fascinating costume design on the catwalk stage! Whoever earns the greatest fame after three fashion show seasons will be crowned the Master of Catwalk. But be alert! Don't let those copycats get all the fame out of cloning your masterpiece!

In Copy Catwalk, players earn fame points by carefully playing their cat cards (number 0-10 plus three Copycat). Cat cards with higher number (more gorgeous costumes) win you some bonus, but only if no one play the same number as yours. Playing Copycat cards grants you no fame points, but they give you chances to copy other players scored costumes in the end of every season.

Manage your cat cards carefully, predict your competitors' next move wisely, wish for the best luck using your Copycat, and you shall become the Master of Copy Catwalk!
